JobFullDesc:
Primary Function of Position:
Install and support the Intuitive Surgical products and ensure service agreements and warranty obligations are fulfilled. Exceed customer expectations and maintain customer satisfaction to the highest possible level.

*Internal promotions require Promotion board approval

Roles and Responsibilities:

Pre-site verifications to prepare site for system installation. 
Assist in coordination of system delivery (e.g. confirming site readiness).
Perform system installations.
Install system upgrades.
Provide technical and clinical support to end-users and other ISI employees.
Train the customer on new features or enhancements made to existing features. 
Perform maintenance inspections as required to ensure the system meets performance specifications.
Troubleshoot and repair Intuitive Surgical products and associated equipment failures as required.
Maintain accurate configurations of installed base.
Present and sell Service Agreements.
Manage spare parts inventory.
Support trade show activity.
Provide back up support to adjacent FE’s.
Administrative duties, which include but not limited to; Field Activity Reports, Return Material Authorizations, Expense Reports etc.
Act as a liaison for customers to HQ and Sales.
Provide feedback to HQ to improve processes and improve efficiencies.
Develop rapport with hospital staff.
Competent in knowledge and implementation of O.R. protocol.

Skill/Job Requirements: 

5-10 years of experience as a Field Service Engineer, including experience in the medical device industry.


BS in electrical or mechanical engineering or equivalent training/experience. 


Working knowledge of O.R. protocol.
Proven ability to independently troubleshoot complex electro-mechanical systems including original systems failures.
Proven track record in providing guidance to junior FSE’s.
Consistently has met Field Service Matrix goals with a score between 95% and 100% for 3 to 5 years.
Track record of solid relationships with Surgeons and Hospital staff.
Well versed at presenting and selling service contracts.


General Computer skills.
Strong administrative and record keeping skills.
Good written and oral communication skills.
Has traveled outside the region to Head Quarters or other field service territories.
Able to lift 100 lbs and move objects up to 1200 lbs.
Has attended/ completed MDP training or has filled in as a DVSTAT  TSE.
